page.title: 05ECOLOGY-NORTH
page.content: To the north of Callander we mostly find coniferous trees.There are also silver birch,oak and sycamore trees. There are primroses growing beside streams because they like dampness. {Red deer}and{grouse}live on the heathe which grows on the top of the Crags.In autumn many toadstools feed on the dead leaves which have fallen. There are many{birds}in the north of Callander:owls that feed on mice and voles,woodpeckers,woodpigeons,kestrals buzzards and very rarely a capercaillie.{Red and grey {squirrels,roe deer and badgers}live in the woods.there are grass snakes and adders in the area and other reptiles like toads and newts. On the Crags the main cause of pollution is litter left by visitors.
